title: Fuck Mobility Creep
body:
Its getting retarded.

Edit:  The fact that a 6 word post saying fuck mobility creep, its getting retarded was enough to get this many upvotes this fast gives me hope for the LoL community.

Thanks, I'm pre law, as you can see.

off topic, but im in law school and some Supreme Court opinions have worse arguments than "fuck mobility creep. its getting retarded"

> [{quoted}](name=Retillin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qmEb08pb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-13T15:32:25.368+0000)
>
> Strong argument and well thought out thesis.

There's no need for arguments. Everyone knows it's getting out of hand
oh, get this. riot is nerfing veig's only form of cc to make it impossible to land on all of these high mobility targets. I think riot actually WANTS mobility creep.

Riot is nerfing Veig's only form of CC to make it actually counterable.
Veigar's instant undodgeable stun that lasts 2.5 seconds is ridiculous and should be toned down.

Undodgeable stuns are equally undodgeable by everyone.

Dodgeable stuns give the advantage to champions born with mobility.

Such was the necessary evil of the game. Now mobile champions have one less counter.

But having a small window (I'm guessing less than 0.5sec) allows them to give him more burst if he lands it (in theory).  Because as it stands, his kit is 100% unavoidable : targeted+targeted+instant stun+skilshot that drops while you're stunned by aforementionned instant stun. 
A fed veigar WAS scary. Now they're giving themselves the tools to allow a non-fed veigar to be scary too.

***They don't want him to land it!*** 

> we saw the ideal Event Horizon being more about trapping your opponent in a cage for Veigar to torment than simply about stunning a dude at 1025 range

and

>This definitely represents a shift in how Veigar uses this ability, but our belief is that this version of the spell is much healthier and leads to more fun interactions between Veigar and his hapless victims. Instead of blowing up a prone target, Veigar traps his prey in a chamber of horrors and shoots Baleful Strikes at them and drops Dark Matters where they have limited space to dodge.

Veigar isn't intended to stun anyone anymore. He's suppose to trap someone and bombard them from 850 range using Q and W. If they look like they might die, then he waddles up and uses R, hopefully before they jump at him and blow his face off.

"Hapless" is the term I'd use for Veigar, not his "victims". If I wanted to play a bombardment oriented mage I'd play Ziggs or Xerath.

But they don't have a fun box to stuff the enemy team into. :3

This actually sounds like a pretty fun direction to push him, locking his enemies in a dungeon then pummeling them with spells sounds great really. 

Veigar has needed work for a while. When played perfectly there was literally nothing his opponents could do, and he had to be stupid weak to compensate. Now he can have a better average case since his best case went down.

sure, until you try to lead yer gate so that they'll walk into only to realize that the "warning particles" allow the enemy to take a small step back, turn around flash out of your gate, and delete you with their burst and/or more reliable cc.

I highly doubt anyone with Veigar's burst has more reliable CC. Though yeah, bruisers will beat him to death, that is no different than it already was. And if they flash over your cage then you can walk right back into it and now have a shield. And if they double back through it to get you they eat the stun, then you can judge "can I kill him" vs. "do I run while he is stunned."

We can play that game all day though. Do you see what I am saying? Its a more interesting spell now, simply by virtue of the enemies getting to interact with him.

until after the 30-40 min mark, annie has very comparable burst to veigar, and waaaay more reliable cc (all of her spells are undodgeable and 2 of her spells rely on her to miss rather than the enemy to dodge)

Also, leblanc's ult (rq and re) have both higher base dmg and ap ratio than veigar's ult at rank 3.

Veigar: 500 + 1.0 ap

Le Blance: 600 + 1.3 ap

and don't bother bringing up the enemy ap ratio thing on veig's ult, if both lb and veig target anyone but the apc lb wins every time.


Veigar is, and always has been about making picks and deleting a high priority target. With these changes, he lost dmg (so deleting is now harder) and reliabilty (making picks is now almost impossible)

So what nich does he fulfill now? Generic "throw stuff in a general direction and hope it hits" mage? we've got tons of those: ziggs, xerath, lux, nid, morg(binding)

The problem I have with this is the way that Riot are biased in their changes.

An instant undodgeable stun is not a good design, it's not a fun ability to play against.  I can agree with that.
But how often do you even see a Veigar?  Why are changes like this (while good) given such priority, while the huge problematic champions, the ones seen in almost every game, are never touched?

I understand your point but does an champion having low popularity warrant buffs?
Does it allow for their skill set to be without counterplay?
Also, does a champion being popular necessarily mean they are a problem? (fuck j4 though)

Fuck "Counter-play". its a overused bullshit term that rito uses to justify just about anything in terms of balance. 

You don't need counter play in this MOBA. Champions should be created to fit a role and ONLY a role, solves this whole issue of "Counter-play" and balance in general. Example: What if we had actual assassins?

~~Fizz~~ (Ditto about him, I cant tell if riot deleted him yet), Zed, akali. They have too much safety to be assassins. They are bullshit "wipe entire team cuz we cant get hit by cc and/or die at all". An assassin has the sole role of killing the ADC/mage and then dying or being rendered useless. Do you see that in Akali? Whom just snowballs and kills an entire team regardless of order.

> [{quoted}](name=Solaxo,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qmEb08pb,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2015-02-13T16:09:21.607+0000)
>
> There's no need for arguments. Everyone knows it's getting out of hand

And it's only getting worse. 2014 in particular was a big offender. All champions released last year (only 6 mind you) beside Vel'Koz had some mobility (some extreme case like Kalista too). Most of them also had overloaded kits (this seems to be the norm now).

I don't know what to think of Riot anymore to be honest. To me it seems they are heavily biased in their balance philosophy as soon as mobility is involved because it makes LC$ big plays...

They want to remove "no counterplay" pattern (aka point and click stun and such). I can understand that. Problem is, it's becoming the only way to deal with the insane rising mobility in this game. Adding "counterplay" to everything pretty much means all mobility champions will have even more of an advantage against immobile ones.

They have the same problem that Pokémon has (if you play Pokémon you'll understand): New things outclass really hard the old ones. Every new thing has more and more things compared to the older one. The same as Talonflame simply outclassing Pidgeot.

Back to LoL, you only need to realize that older champions are now played only if they have mobility (Kata, Akali, Lee Sin). Comparing Anivia to Azir for example (who are supposed to have a similar role) it's just awkward.

Champions with large mobility should not ever have access to high amounts of damage. We have seen it with the Old Leblanc and with Kalista. Mobility should trade off something such as higher damage with chase potential and safety for the champion.

I just want them to add some other features to new champions for fucks sake. I'm so tired of seeing/hearing "well what's really unique about this champion is his/her high mobility". Like fuck off that shit is so played out and retarded. Mobility is no a unique feature anymore it is a necessity to be in the meta which ends up being the only champions riot gives a fuck about because they are too busy going down on TSM and shit to see that their real player base is sick of their bullshit.

Just remember, Jinx is their idea of a Modern defenseless ADC.
She enjoys massive ranged AoE Crits, Huge speed buff on passive, A slow+vision (originally True vision), and an AoE root.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qmEb08pb,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-02-13T16:37:53.304+0000)
>
> Just remember, Jinx is their idea of a Modern defenseless ADC.
> She enjoys massive ranged AoE Crits, Huge speed buff on passive, A slow+vision (originally True vision), and an AoE root.

Thats not that different than Varus or Ashe honestly, its just actually designed with their modern understanding of a good character. Jinx is limited by her lack of escapes but Varus and Ashe are limited by like 20 random things they can't control. 

All the newer champions are weak in the ways of their class and can work around their weakness but not avoid it. Older champions literally have a giant fucking weakness as a spike in their left kidney and they can't remove it ever.
What about veigar? Riot's quintessential immobile mage? To me, it looks like they are just driving the spike even deeper with the changes to his stun.

Katarina is also quite stupid, yes.
I didn't even need to read the post to know it deserved an upvote.
It makes me happy to know that I am not the only one that feels like this.

Itd be nice if every champion with something strong had something similar to the Yasuo passive that cuts his crit damage potential in exchange for double crit percentage. I never really understood why game companies hate doing stuff like that. You have something with a really strong presence in one aspect, so you cut down one of their other aspects to compensate, it just makes sense like wtf.
Another problem is that many of the champions with access to insane mobility aren't at all mana hungry (most don't even mana!).

The ability to move about in cool ways can be cool. 

The ability to move wherever the hell you want whenever the hell you want, invalidating a large amount of the champion pool, is just bad design.
But Zed is a healthy assassin. And chasing Lee for an hour, until his ult comes off cooldown and he kills you is the most fun League has to offer.
why would you chase lee?

Because we can't find a Singed to chase anymore
;-;
Its why poor Veigar is getting a double nerf (Rework™) next patch. You don't have a place in league if you aren't some gymnastic, backflipping ninja. #LCSPLAYZ

> [{quoted}](name=FDS Desperado,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qmEb08pb,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-02-13T15:28:46.725+0000)
>
> Its getting retarded.

Typical bandwagoning on the 3 year old bandwagon...Oh wait Riot hasn't stopped.

Another thing I don't get is why does everything have to be a dash? What's wrong with simply getting bonus MS? It's much easier to combat, and still has obvious benefits. I get that that wouldn't solve all of the issues, but I just think that blinks/Flash-esque are overshadowing possible, healthy MS boosts.
Bonus MS tends to be problematic too because then you have champions who can traverse the map really quickly

Skillshot dashes tend to be problematic because ppl can flash through walls every 10 seconds.

I will take {{champion:78}} 's insane MS steroid over{{champion:81}} {{champion:236}} 's 10 second cooldown flash any day.
Lmfao amen.
Mobility creep wouldn't bother me if they added mobility to the kits of old champs.  The problem is that if you don't play a mobile champ, you tend to get left in the dust.

> [{quoted}](name=Chamenas,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qmEb08pb,comment-id=002d,timestamp=2015-02-14T18:49:01.855+0000)

> Mobility creep wouldn't bother me if they added mobility to the kits of old champs.  The problem is that if you don't play a mobile champ, you tend to get left in the dust.

That's literally just making mobility creep worse. They need to start making mobility have an actual cost and adding counters to it rather than removing them.
I Completely agree. Mobility creep is getting to the point where any champ that doesn't have some for of on demand mobility is never going to be as competitive as someone with it.
L C $ B I G P L A Y $

I 100% agree. For the past 2 seasons my main has been Zyra. She has the slowest movespeed in the game and now is becoming a huge liability to pick in this meta. Especially at my elo (D5) I can't make a single mistake without paying for it with my life.

All these new champions can make several mistakes and still be ok due to there insane mobility. At this point, champions with several gap closers/escapes need to have slower base movespeed and those with no escapes or gap closers need higher base movespeed to at least make them viable.

> At this point, champions with several gap closers/escapes need to have slower base

The best part is when you look at champions like Zyra or Anivia whose have zero mobility and they have 325 movement speed.
Then you look to insane-mobile champions like Zed, Yasuo or Katarina and most of them have 345/350 movement speed. THEY COMPLETELY NEEDED IT.

Agreed. I mained {{champion:72}} jg until the mana regen changes crippled him.

Then I mained {{champion:421}} until she was gutted, and did better than I ever did with Skarner.

Now {{champion:254}} is my main jungler, and I frequently carry games.

Sorry but the truth is, mobility is power.
